title: ‘Memory shortage could slow AI boom,’ warns DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis
description: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis has warned that a global memory chip shortage could slow the rapid growth of artificial intelligence. As tech giants ramp up spending on AI infrastructure, limited chip supply is emerging as a serious bottleneck for future innovation.
content: Amid the recent upgrade on artificial intelligence, the world is talking about just one thing, is AI the coming future or the receptive verse? In 2026, the artificial intelligence models have performed exceptionally well and better than ever. Google ... [1936 chars]

title: Galway’s PorterShed turns to Philip Reynolds’ AI app to get the right brew for start-ups
description: One of the main start-up accelerators in the west of Ireland has turned to artificial intelligence to help develop the next batch of promising young high-growth companies.
content:
Galway-based start-up accelerator the PorterShed is to launch a new scheme that uses an AI-driven app developed by Philip Reynolds – son of former taoiseach Albert Reynolds – to help 50 local hopefuls win lucrative Enterprise Ireland funding.

title: World Thinking Day: 7 subtle ways AI is changing how we think
description: From memory and creativity to decision-making habits, emerging psychology research shows how artificial intelligence is subtly reshaping human thinking. Experts explain seven ways everyday AI use may already be influencing how we learn and make choices.
content:

title: The Moon is getting an AI brain this summer and it won’t need Earth to think
description: Science News: The Moon is about to get its own brain. For the first time, real-time artificial intelligence and edge computing have been installed on a lunar rover..
content:

title: The great AI divide: While the West wrestles with tech winter of scepticism, the Global South seems to be experiencing a digital spring
description: As the AI Impact Summit 2026 in New Delhi concludes, a clear divide has emerged in how regions view artificial intelligence. While many Western countries show caution, much of the Global South, including India and China, remains strongly optimistic. Prime Minister Narendra Modi said at the summit, “while some see fear in AI, India sees its future in it”, reflecting the countrys forward-looking stance on the technology.
content:

title: India and Brazil set $30 billion trade target by 2030; sign mineral, rare earth pact
description: Brazilian President Lula noted that India’s strengths in information technology, artificial intelligence, biotechnology and the space sector have opened up fresh avenues for collaboration.
content:
India and Brazil on Saturday agreed to significantly raise their bilateral trade target to $30 billion by 2030, revising the earlier goal of $20 billion.

title: Tavleen Singh writes: Artificial intelligence, real hubris
description: If AI can do what humans have failed to, then we need to embrace it with open arms and ensure that it spreads rapidly across rural India where it is needed more than in the cities. But before that happens, we need to build the infrastructure it requires to be able to make a difference.
